title: Dumfries & District Amateur Football League
text:
The Dumfries & District Amateur Football League (DDAFL) was a <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> league competition for amateur teams in the <a href="Dumfries">Dumfries</a> area of <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>. It was founded in 1954 and ran through until 2014 when the league disbanded, with member clubs subsequently joining different amateur leagues or the <a href="South%20of%20Scotland%20Football%20League">South of Scotland Football League</a>.
History.
The league's first championship took place in the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20in%20Scottish%20football">1954–55 season</a>, with Dumfries Amateurs the inaugural victors. The league continued through until 2014 when it was disbanded following its final season featuring only seven clubs. Of these, 2013–14 and final champions Lochmaben joined the <a href="North%20%26amp%3B%20South%20Lanarkshire%20Amateur%20Football%20Association">North & South Lanarkshire AFA</a> whereas <a href="Upper%20Annandale%20F.C.">Upper Annandale</a> & <a href="Dumfries%20YMCA%20F.C.">Dumfries YMCA</a> became members of the <a href="South%20of%20Scotland%20Football%20League">South of Scotland Football League</a>.
